intro: Crotalaria cunninghamii, commonly known as the yellow crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which can remain viable in the soil for many years. Due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in harsh conditions, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
